ifm_schema.description: Common interface management. It includes the public configuration of interfaces.

statistic-interval.description: Set the interval at which global flow statistics are collected.

ipv4-ignore-primary-sub.description: Enable/disable the function of ignoring primary/secondary of IPv4 address type. All secondary addresses must be deleted before this function is enabled.

sub-interface-link-trap-enable.description: Enable/disable the trap function on all Sub-interface.

damp.description: Enable/disable suppression on interfaces' physical status flappings.

tx-off.description: Enable/disable interfaces from sending signals if the interfaces' physical status flappings are suppressed.

auto-recovery-times.description: List of automatic recovery time configuration.

time-value.description: Delay for the status transition from down to up.

interfaces.description: List of configuring information on an interface.

interface.description: Configure information on an interface. Physical, NULL, Virtual-if, and Virtual-Template0 interfaces cannot be created or deleted.

name.description: The textual name of the interface. It should be the name of the interface as assigned by the local device. It should be suitable for use in commands which entered at the device's 'console'. This might be a text name, such as 'NULL0', depending on the interface naming syntax of the device.

class.description: Identify a main interface or a sub-interface.

type.description: Type of an interface. Interfaces include physical and logical interfaces.

parent-name.description: Name of the main interface. For example, Ethernet0/1/0.

number.description: Number of an interface. For example,1, 0/1/0, or 2:1.

description.description: Description of an interface.

admin-status.description: Administrative status of an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

link-protocol.description: Link protocol. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

router-type.description: Route attribute of an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

clear-ip-df.description: Enable/disable a device to forcibly fragment IP packets on an outbound interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

link-up-down-trap-enable.description: Enable/disable the trap function on an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

statistic-enable.description: Enable/disable the statistics function on an interface. The default value of this node varies according to different interface types. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

statistic-mode.description: Mode of statistics collection. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

bandwidth-type.description: Configure the bandwidth of an interface.

bandwidth-mbps.description: Configure the bandwidth of an interface.

bandwidth.description: Configure the bandwidth of an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

bandwidth-kbps.description: Configure the bandwidth of an interface.
Configure the bandwidth of an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

mtu.description:
Maximum transmission unit of an interface.
Special explanation:
Range: The server may restrict the allowed values for this leaf, depending on the interface types.
Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

spread-mtu-flag.description: Enable/disable the function of spreading the MTU value of main interface to subinterface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

statistic-interval.description: Interval at which flow statistics are collected on an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

vrf-name.description: Name of a VPN instance. It uniquely identifies a VPN instance. The VRF name of the DCN interface cannot be created, modified, or deleted.

l2-mode-enable.description: Enable/disable the function of creating an L2 Sub-interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

mac-address.description: Config MAC Address. Constraints on MAC address configuration varies according to interfaces. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

position.description: Position of an interface. For example, 0/1/0. Data can be queried only on physical interfaces.

is-l2-switch.description: To identify a layer2 switch port.

vs-name.description: Name of a VS to which an interface belongs.

l2-switch-port-index.description: L2 switch port index of an interface.

protocol-up-delay-time.description: Specify the protocol up-delay-time value in seconds.

control-flap.description: Enable/disable flapping control on an interface.

suppress.description: Suppression threshold on an interface. The value must be greater than the reusing threshold and smaller than the suppression upper limit.

reuse.description: Reusing threshold of an interface. The value must be smaller than the suppression threshold.

ceiling.description: Maximum suppression value on an interface. The value should be greater than the damping suppression threshold.

decay-ok.description: The penalty value of an Up interface attenuates to 1/2.

decay-ng.description: The penalty value of a Down interface attenuates to 1/2.

control-flap-count.description: Status suppression count of an interface.

ignore-damp.description: Configure an interface to ignore the global damp-interface function.

ignore-global-damp.description: Enable/disable an interface to ignore the global damp-interface function.

damp.description: Enable/disable suppression on an interface's physical status flappings.

tx-off.description: Enable/disable an interface suppressed due to status flapping from sending signals.

damp-state.description: Operational state of interface suppression information.

ipv4-status.description: IPv4 Protocol status of an interface.

ipv6-status.description: IPv6 protocol status of an interface.

sub-if-counts.description: Number of sub-interfaces on this interface.

send-byte.description: Number of bytes sent on an interface.

receive-packet.description: Number of packets received on an interface.

send-packet.description: Number of packets sent on an interface.

receive-multicast-packet.description: Number of multicast packets received on an interface.

send-broad-packet.description: Number of broadcast packets sent on an interface.

send-drop-packet.description: Number of sent packets discarded on an interface.

eth-port-err-sts.description: Operational state of error packet statistics on an Ethernet interface.

rx-jumbo-octets.description: The packet length is longer than 1518 bytes.

rx-over-run.description: Packet overflowed from the FIFO in the inbound direction.

rx-jabber.description: CRC error packet whose length is longer than 1518 bytes.

rx-alignment.description: Packet whose length is not an integer multiply of 8 bits.

rx-fragment.description: CRC packet whose length is shorter than 64 bytes.

rx-undersize.description: Packet whose length is shorter than 64 bytes.

tx-jumbo-octets.description: The length of a packet sent is longer than 1518 bytes.

tx-over-run.description: Overflow statistics in the transmit direction.

tx-under-run.description: Underflow statistics in the transmit direction.

tx-system.description: There is no EOP or SOP packet.

tx-lost.description: Discarded packet in the transmit direction.

stati-interval.description: Current interval at which interface flow statistics are collected.

in-byte-rate.description: Rate at which bytes are received within the interval.

in-bit-rate.description: Rate at which bits are received within the interval.

in-packet-rate.description: Rate at which packets are received within the interval.

in-use-rate.description: Input bandwidth usage within the interval.

out-byte-rate.description: Rate at which bytes are sent within the interval.

out-bit-rate.description: Rate at which bits are sent within the interval.

out-packet-rate.description: Rate at which packets are sent within the interval.

out-use-rate.description: Output bandwidth usage within the interval.

send-byte.description: Number of sent bytes, which can be cleared.

send-error-packet.description: Number of sent error packets, which can be cleared.

receive-unicast-bit.description: Number of unicast bits received on an interface.

send-multicast-bit.description: Number of multicast bits sent on an interface.

send-broad-bit.description: Number of broadcast bits sent on an interface.

send-broadcast-packet-rate.description: Rate of broadcast packets sent on an interface.

receive-broadcast-packet-rate.description: Rate of broadcast packets received on an interface.

error-down.description: Information about the interface in the error-down state, including the interface name, cause of the error-down event, delay for the transition from down to up, and remaining time for the up state.

recovery-time.description: Delay for the transition from down to up.

remainder-time.description: The remaining time for the up event.

tunnel-protocol.description:
Configure tunnel protocol.
Special explanation:
Constraint: If a tunnel is locked, all configurations of the tunnel cannot be deleted or modified.

type.description: Tunnel interface link layer encapsulation protocol type.

damping-time.description: Delay time after which a BDIF interface goes down.
Delay time after which a VLANIF interface goes down.

address.description: The IPv4 address can be specified as negotiated or unnumbered or ordinarily address.

addresses.description: List of common addresses. The IPv4 address of the DCN interface cannot be created, modified, or deleted.

unnumbered-address.description: Configure unnumbered interface. The address borrowing relationship of the DCN interface cannot be created, modified, or deleted.

is-block.description: IPv4 address is blocked or not.

ipv6.description: Enable/disable the IPv6 capability on an interface.

mtu6.description:
IPv6 maximum transmission unit of an interface.
Special explanation:
Range: The server may restrict the allowed values for this leaf, depending on the interface's type.

spread-mtu-flag.description: Enable/disable the function of spreading the IPv6 MTU of main interface to subinterface.

auto-link-local.description: Enable/disable an interface with the auto linklocal address function.

prefix-length.description: Length of the IPv6 address prefix.

IPv6 maximum transmission unit of an interface.
Special explanation:
Range: The server may restrict the allowed values for this leaf, depending on the interface's type.

is-block.description: IPv6 address is blocked or not.

status.description: IPv6 address status.

trunk-vlans.description: List of VLANs that are allowed to pass.

untag-vlans.description: List of untagged VLANs that are allowed to pass.

stacking-vlan.description: VLAN ID in the outer VLAN tag after VLAN stacking is performed.

ce-default.description: Add a VLAN tag to received untagged packets.

trans-vlans.description: List of VLAN IDs of received packets. VLANs are used to control traffic access. Only one VLAN can be configured on an interface and all its sub-interfaces.

vlan-stacking-remarks.description: List of VLAN stacking with remark.

vlan-stacking-remark.description: Configure VLAN stacking interface with remark 8021p.

mapping-vlan.description: VLAN ID in the VLAN tag after VLAN mapping is performed.

trans-vlans.description: List of VLAN IDs in VLAN tags before VLAN mapping is performed.

vlan-mapping-remarks.description: List of VLAN mapping with remark.

vlan-mapping-remark.description: Configure VLAN mapping interface with remark 8021p.

vlans.description: VLAN list. The specified VLAN must have been added to an interface.

mode.description: Include single and multiple modes. The mode cannot be modified after being referenced.

statistic-enable.description: Enable/disable VLAN group-based QinQ packet statistics.

description.description: VLAN group description.

flow-type.description: Specify an encapsulation type. After an encapsulation type is specified, it cannot be changed to another encapsulation type. In addition, it can not be deleted if a service has been configured in the same interface. If an encapsulation type fails to be specified, see the error message to determine the failure cause.

vlan-type-vid.description: VLAN ID of the VLAN sub-interface;

dot1q-vlans.description: List of dot1q termination configuration. When tag-type is rt-protocol, this node can only configure one VLAN.

vlan-list.description: Dot1q termination VLAN ID list.
Dot1q termination VLAN ID list. The VLAN in VLAN-list can not exist in../../dot1q-VLANs-group/VLAN-list.

policy-vlan-groups.description: List of sub-interface policy VLAN with gorup.

vrrps.description: Configure dot1q VRRP list. VLAN-id must be configured on the interface.

pwtag.description: Configure the P-Tag of the packets in the PW with VLAN.

tag.description: Tag type, include local switching, rt-protocol and none type, this value can not be merged.

remark-type.description: Trust the 802.1p in the outer VLAN tag, inner VLAN tag, or user-defined precedence.

user-mode.description: Enable or disable the user mode.

group-id.description: Specified VLAN group ID. The group-id cannot be modified after the qinq-vid is created.

pwtag.description: Configure the P-Tag of the packets in the PW with VLAN.

vlan-type-vid.description: VLAN ID of the VLAN sub-interface.

dscp-values.description: DSCP policy value. The dscp-values ranges of different sub-interfaces on the same main interface cannot overlap.

local-switch.description: Enable/disable local switching on a sub-interface for QinQ VLAN tag termination.

vlan-id-begin.description: Start VLAN ID in the user packet.

vlan-id-end.description: End VLAN ID in the user packet.

qinq-with-pe-segments.description: List of QinQ encapsulation with PE VLAN segment.

qinq-with-pe-segment.description: Configure QinQ encapsulation with PE VLAN segment.

flow-action.description: Configure packet rewriting information. If the interface is bound to a BD, this node cannot be modified.

offset-value.description: Offset value of the modified VLAN.

track-pw-state.description: Enable/disable association between the PW status with the interface status.

l3ve-delay-up.description: Configure the delay function for an L3VE interface to go up.

source-vtep-ip.description: The address of interface NVE, as VXLAN tunnel source point.

source-vtep-ipv6.description: The IPv6 address of interface NVE, as VXLAN tunnel source point.

bypass-vtep-ipv6.description: The IPv6 address of interface NVE, as source point in bypass VXLAN tunnel.

pip.description: Configure primary IP address as bypass VXLAN tunnel.

source-ip.description: The address of interface NVE, as VXLAN tunnel source point.

peer-ip.description: The address of interface NVE, as VXLAN tunnel peer point.

nvo3-gateway.description: Configure anycast gateway features for NVO3.

name.description: Configure EVPL instances bound to an EVPN instance.

esi.description: Static ESI, in the format of 00xx.xxxx.xxxx.xxxx.xxxx, in which x ranges from 0 to F. A static ESI cannot be all 0s. To clear a static ESI, enter a space.

esi-name.description: Dynamic ESI name is a string of 1 to 31 characters, which begins with a-z or A-Z.

track-bfd-name.description: Specify the BFD that track ESI peer.

e-tree-leaf.description: Enable/disable the E-Tree leaf attribute of interface.

trusts.description: List of configure trust ip-dscp or 8021p.

traffic-policy-applys.description: List of configure traffic policy application.

layer.description: Classification based on layer 2 or layer 3 information.

identifier.description: Identifier. The range supported by this node varies according to the interface type. This node does not support modification or deletion.

traffic-policy-multi-applys.description: List of configure traffic multi policy application.

match-precedence.description: Specify the precedence of traffic policy.

profile-applys.description: List of configure QoS profile application.

identify-type.description: Identify type. The range supported by this node varies according to the interface type.

group-name.description: The name of user queue group.

profile-apply.x-key: profile-name direction type pe-vlan-id ce-begin-vlan-id ce-end-vlan-id identify-type

user-queue-applys.description: List of configure user queue application.

cir.description: Committed information rate.

normal-evpn_schema.description: Configure normal mode of EVPN instance.

description.description: The description for EVPN instance.

rd.description:
An EVPN instance address family takes effect only after it is configured with an RD. The RD can be in any of the following formats:
1. 16-bit AS number:32-bit user-defined number, 101:3 for example. A 16-bit AS number ranges from 0 to 65535, and a user-defined number ranges from 0 to 4294967295. The AS number and user-defined number cannot be both 0s. This means that the RD value cannot be 0:0.
2. 32-bit IP address:16-bit user-defined number, 192.168.122.15:1 for example. The IP address ranges from 0.0.0.0 to 255.255.255.255, and the user-defined number ranges from 0 to 65535.
3. 32-bit AS number:16-bit user-defined number, 10.11:3 for example. A 32-bit AS number ranges from 0.0 to 65535.65535 or from 0 to 4294967295, and a user-defined number ranges from 0 to 65535. The AS number and user-defined number cannot be both 0s. This means that the RD value cannot be 0.0:0.

import-policy-name.description: The name of specify import route policy.

export-policy-name.description: The name of specify export route policy.

local-remote-frr.description: Enable/disable local MAC and remote MAC to form FRR.

isolate-spoken.description: Forwarding isolation between AC interfaces under EVPN.

export-acl-name-or-id.description: Name or number of an IPv4 ACL used by a filtering policy to filter the routes to be advertised to a specified peer. The number ranges from 4000 to 4999, and the name must start with a letter.

import-acl-name-or-id.description: Name or number of an IPv4 ACL used by a filtering policy to filter the routes received from a specified peer. The number ranges from 4000 to 4999, and the name must start with a letter. By default, no ACL-based filtering policy is configured, and therefore all EVN BGP routes can be accepted.

rt.description: Configure RTs to control route advertisement between network nodes. Before sending a VPN route to a PE, the local PE adds an Export RT to the route. After receiving a route from another PE, the local PE compares the local Import RT and the Export RT carried in the VPN route and adds the route to the VPN instance only when the two RTs are the same.

vrf-rt-type.description:
RT type (export-extcommunity or import-extcommunity)
export-extcommunity: Specifies the value of the extended community attribute of the route from an outbound interface to the destination VPN.
import-extcommunity: Specifies the value of the extended community attribute. Routes with such an extended community value can be accepted.

vrf-rt-value.description:
RT value, in any of the following formats:
1. 16-bit AS number:32-bit user-defined number, 1:3 for example. A 16-bit AS number ranges from 0 to 65535, and a user-defined number ranges from 0 to 4294967295. The AS number and user-defined number cannot be both 0s. This means that the VPN Target value cannot be 0:0.
2. 32-bit IP address:16-bit user-defined number, 192.168.122.15:1 for example. The IP address ranges from 0.0.0.0 to 255.255.255.255, and the user-defined number ranges from 0 to 65535.
3. 32-bit AS number:16-bit user-defined number, 10.11:3 for example. A 32-bit AS number ranges from 0.0 to 65535.65535 or from 0 to 4294967295, and a user-defined number ranges from 0 to 65535. The AS number and user-defined number cannot be both 0s. This means that the VPN Target value cannot be 0.0:0.

The AS number and user-defined number cannot be both 0s. This means that the VPN Target value cannot be 0.0:0.
